member.name: T:Technosoftware.UaServer.IUaNodeManager
member.summary: An interface to an object that manages a set of nodes in the address space.

member.name: P:Technosoftware.UaServer.IUaNodeManager.NamespaceUris
member.summary: Returns the NamespaceUris for the Nodes belonging to the NodeManager.
member.remarks:
By default the MasterNodeManager uses the namespaceIndex to determine who owns an Node.
Servers that do not wish to partition their address space this way must provide their own implementation of MasterNodeManager.GetManagerHandle().
NodeManagers which depend on a custom partitioning scheme must return a null value.

member.name: P:Technosoftware.UaServer.IUaNodeManager.AliasRoot
member.summary: The root for the alias assigned to the node manager.

member.name: P:Technosoftware.UaServer.IUaNodeManager.MonitoredNodes
member.summary: Gets the table of nodes being monitored.

member.name: P:Technosoftware.UaServer.IUaNodeManager.Lock
member.summary: Acquires the lock on the node manager.

member.name: P:Technosoftware.UaServer.IUaNodeManager.ServerData
member.summary: Gets the server data that the node manager belongs to.

member.name: M:Technosoftware.UaServer.IUaNodeManager.CreateAddressSpace(System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{Opc.Ua.NodeId,System.Collections.Generic.IList{Opc.Ua.IReference}})
member.summary: Creates the address space by loading any configuration information an connecting to an underlying system (if applicable).
member.returns: A table of references that need to be added to other node managers.
member.remarks: A node manager owns a set of nodes. These nodes may be known in advance or they may be stored in an external system are retrived on demand. These nodes may have two way references to nodes that are owned by other node managers. In these cases, the node managers only manage one half of those references. The other half of the reference should be returned to the MasterNodeManager.

member.name: M:Technosoftware.UaServer.IUaNodeManager.DeleteAddressSpace
member.summary: Deletes the address by releasing all resources and disconnecting from any underlying system.

member.name: M:Technosoftware.UaServer.IUaNodeManager.GetManagerHandle(Opc.Ua.NodeId)
member.summary: Returns an opaque handle identifying to the node to the node manager.
member.returns: A node handle, null if the node manager does not recognize the node id.
member.remarks: The method must not block by querying an underlying system. If the node manager wraps an underlying system then it must check to see if it recognizes the syntax of the node id. The handle in this case may simply be a partially parsed version of the node id.

member.name: M:Technosoftware.UaServer.IUaNodeManager.SessionClosing(Technosoftware.UaServer.UaServerOperationContext,Opc.Ua.NodeId,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Called when the session is closed.

member.summary: Returns true if the namespace for the node id is one of the namespaces managed by the node manager.
member.returns: True if the namespace is one of the nodes.

member.name: M:Technosoftware.UaServer.IUaNodeManager.IsNodeInView(Technosoftware.UaServer.UaServerOperationContext,Opc.Ua.NodeId,System.Object)
member.summary: Returns true if the node is in the view.

member.name: M:Technosoftware.UaServer.IUaNodeManager.AddReferences(System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{Opc.Ua.NodeId,System.Collections.Generic.IList{Opc.Ua.IReference}})
member.summary: Adds references to the node manager.
member.remarks: The node manager checks the dictionary for nodes that it owns and ensures the associated references exist.

member.name: M:Technosoftware.UaServer.IUaNodeManager.DeleteReference(System.Object,Opc.Ua.NodeId,System.Boolean,Opc.Ua.ExpandedNodeId,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Deletes a reference.

member.name: M:Technosoftware.UaServer.IUaNodeManager.GetNodeMetadata(Technosoftware.UaServer.UaServerOperationContext,System.Object,Opc.Ua.BrowseResultMask)
member.summary: Returns the metadata associated with the node.
member.remarks: Returns null if the node does not exist.

member.name: M:Technosoftware.UaServer.IUaNodeManager.Browse(Technosoftware.UaServer.UaServerOperationContext,Technosoftware.UaServer.UaContinuationPoint@,System.Collections.Generic.IList{Opc.Ua.ReferenceDescription})
member.summary: Returns the set of references that meet the filter criteria.
member.param: The context to used when processing the request.
The continuation point that stores the state of the Browse operation.
The list of references that meet the filter criteria.
member.remarks: NodeManagers will likely have references to other NodeManagers which means they will not be able to apply the NodeClassMask or fill in the attributes for the target Node. In these cases the NodeManager must return a ReferenceDescription with the NodeId and ReferenceTypeId set. The caller will be responsible for filling in the target attributes. The references parameter may already contain references when the method is called. The implementer must include these references when calculating whether a continutation point must be returned.
member.exception: Thrown if the context, continuationPoint or references parameters are null.
Thrown if an error occurs during processing.

member.name: M:Technosoftware.UaServer.IUaNodeManager.TranslateBrowsePath(Technosoftware.UaServer.UaServerOperationContext,System.Object,Opc.Ua.RelativePathElement,System.Collections.Generic.IList{Opc.Ua.ExpandedNodeId},System.Collections.Generic.IList{Opc.Ua.NodeId})
member.summary: Finds the targets of the relative path from the source node.
member.param: The context to used when processing the request.
The handle for the source node.
The NodeIds for any target at the end of the relative path.
The NodeIds for any local target that is in another NodeManager.
member.remarks: A null context indicates that the server's internal logic is making the call. The first target in the list must be the target that matches the instance declaration (if applicable). Any local targets that belong to other NodeManagers are returned as unresolvedTargetIds. The caller must check the BrowseName to determine if it matches the relativePath. The implementor must not throw an exception if the source or target nodes do not exist.
member.exception: Thrown if the sourceHandle, relativePath or targetIds parameters are null.

member.name: M:Technosoftware.UaServer.IUaNodeManager.Read(Technosoftware.UaServer.UaServerOperationContext,System.Double,System.Collections.Generic.IList{Opc.Ua.ReadValueId},System.Collections.Generic.IList{Opc.Ua.DataValue},System.Collections.Generic.IList{Opc.Ua.ServiceResult})
member.summary: Reads the attribute values for a set of nodes.
member.remarks:
The MasterNodeManager pre-processes the nodesToRead and ensures that: - the AttributeId is a known attribute. - the IndexRange, if specified, is valid. - the DataEncoding and the IndexRange are not specified if the AttributeId is not Value.
The MasterNodeManager post-processes the values by: - sets values[ii].StatusCode to the value of errors[ii].Code - creates a instance of DataValue if one does not exist and an errors[ii] is bad. - removes timestamps from the DataValue if the client does not want them.
The node manager must ignore ReadValueId with the Processed flag set to true. The node manager must set the Processed flag for any ReadValueId that it processes.

member.summary: Reads the history of a set of items.

member.remarks: Each node manager should only process node ids that it recognizes. If it processes a value it must set the Processed flag in the WriteValue structure.

summary.para: OPC UA Server Interface
This interface defines the generic server interface.

The IUaServer interface provides a set of generic server callback methods. These methods can be used to read information from the generic server or change data in the generic server. They are always called by the customization plugin.
It also defines classes and enumerators used in the data exchange with the generic server

member.name: P:Technosoftware.UaServer.IUaServer.ServiceExpired
member.summary: Indicates wether the service subscription or evaluation period is expired.

remarks.para: Each product or Maintenance package includes one year of free updates. This means that it is possible to use all licensed products released until plus one year. A product version build after the plus one year date can not be used with this license. In this case this property is set to true and the product is turned into an evaluation version.

strong.em: Of course, a correct combination of license and product can be used as long as you want. It's just not possible to update to a product version newer than plus one year.

remarks.para: If the evaluation period is expired this property is set to true.

member.value: True if either the service subscription or evaluation period expired; false otherwise

member.name: P:Technosoftware.UaServer.IUaServer.RestartRequired

member.name: T:Technosoftware.UaServer.IUaServerData

summary.para: IUaServerData is an interface to a server object that provides the shared components for the UA Server.
The different manager objects use this interface to access shared tables such as the set of NamespaceUris or the ServerStatus.

Any implementation of IUaServerData must be thread safe. The flow of calls must always be one way from one component of the server to the IUaServerData object. Properties of the IUaServerData may return other objects which will have their own rules regarding to call flow.

member.remarks: The BaseServerData object is the standard implementation of this interface. Developers can extend this class to add additional shared data.

summary.para: OPC Server Plugin Interface
This interface defines the server plugin interface. This interface must be implemented by the server plugin assembly.

member.name: M:Technosoftware.UaServer.IUaServerPlugin.OnGetLicenseInformation(Opc.Ua.LicenseHandler.LicenseEdition@,System.String@)
member.summary: This method is called from the generic server to get the license information.
member.remarks: Returning an empty string for the serial number activates the evaluation version of the OPC UA Server SDK .NET Standard. The evaluation allows the usage of the full product for 30 days.

member.name: M:Technosoftware.UaServer.IUaServerPlugin.OnStartup(System.String[])
member.summary: This method is the first method called from the generic server at the startup.
member.param: String array with the command line parameters as they were specified when the server was being started.

remarks.para: The following command line parameters are handled by the generic server:

list.item:
/silent
No output is done during startup of the server

/configfile
Allows the definition of a specific application configuration file

/install
Installs and configures the application according the configuration file, e.g. certificates are created and firewall configured.

/uninstall
Uninstalls the application by removing the changes made during installation.

member.returns: A code with the result of the operation. Returning an error code stops the further server execution.

member.name: M:Technosoftware.UaServer.IUaServerPlugin.OnGetNamespaceUris
member.summary: Defines namespaces used by the application.
member.returns: Array of namespaces that are used by the application.

member.returns: The root folder.

To ensure proper process shutdown, any communication channels should be closed and all threads terminated before this method returns.

The reason why the server shutdowns.
The exception which caused an error. null if not an exception.
member.returns: A code with the result of the operation.

member.summary: This method is called from the generic server when the OPC Server Properties of the current server instance are requested by a client.
member.returns: An ServerProperties object.

member.name: M:Technosoftware.UaServer.IUaServerPlugin.OnWriteBaseVariable(Opc.Ua.BaseVariableState,System.Object@,Opc.Ua.StatusCode@,System.DateTime@)

summary.para: This method is called when a client executes a 'write' server call. The includes all information required to identify the item as well as original (unmodified) value, timestamp and quality. Depending on the returned result code the cache is updated or not in the generic server after returning from this method.
Important: This method is only called for nodes created with

member.param: The of the variable including the original state of the variable. Can be used to check what changes happens
The value which should be written. The returned value is used for updating the cache depending on the returned result code.
A code which should be used as new status code for the value.
The timestamp the value was written. The returned value is used for updating the cache depending on the returned result code.

remarks.para: The following rules apply for updating the cache base on the returned StatusCode:

list.item: If the returned value is Bad (something like Bad...) the cache is not updated with timestamp and value.

If the returned value is GoodCompletesAsynchronously the cache is not updated with timestamp and value. After the customization DLL has finished its operation it can use WriteBaseVariable to update the cache.
In all other cases the cache is updated with timestamp and value.
In all cases the status code is updated with the status code set in the 'statusCode' parameter.

member.returns: A code with the result of the operation.

member.name: M:Technosoftware.UaServer.NodeManager.MasterNodeManager.RegisterNamespaceManager(System.String,Technosoftware.UaServer.IUaNodeManager)
member.summary: Registers the node manager as the node manager for Nodes in the specified namespace.
member.param: The NodeManager which owns node in the namespacee.
member.remarks:
Multiple NodeManagers may register interest in a Namespace. The order in which this method is called determines the precedence if multiple NodeManagers exist. This method adds the namespaceUri to the Server's Namespace table if it does not already exist.
This method is thread safe and can be called at anytime.
This method does not have to be called for any namespaces that were in the NodeManager's NamespaceUri property when the MasterNodeManager was created.
member.exception: Throw if the namespaceUri or the nodeManager are null.

member.name: T:Technosoftware.UaServer.Server.GenericServerData
member.summary: A class that stores the globally accessible state of a server instance.
member.remarks:
This is a readonly class that is initialized when the server starts up. It provides access to global objects and data that different parts of the server may require. It also defines some global methods.
This object is constructed is three steps: - the configuration is provided. - the node managers et. al. are provided. - the session/subscription managers are provided.
The server is not running until all three steps are complete.
The references returned from this object do not change after all three states are complete. This ensures the object is thread safe even though it does not use a lock. Objects returned from this object can be assumed to be threadsafe unless otherwise stated.

member.name: T:Technosoftware.UaServer.UaBaseServer
member.summary: Implements a basic OPC UA Server.
member.remarks: Each server instance must have one instance of a UaBaseServer object which is responsible for reading the configuration file, creating the endpoints and dispatching incoming requests to the appropriate handler. This sub-class specifies non-configurable metadata such as Product Name and initializes the EmptyNodeManager which provides access to the data exposed by the Server.

member.summary: Initializes the object with default values.

member.summary: The Application property is only used during beta phase of the product. It will be removed with the release of the product, so don't use it.

member.summary: Get the node manager.

member.summary: The license owner of the license information provided by

member.summary: The product the license was issued for.

member.name: P:Technosoftware.UaServer.UaBaseServer.LicensedAt
member.summary: The date the license was issued.

member.name: P:Technosoftware.UaServer.UaBaseServer.ServiceExpired
member.summary: Indicates wether the service subscription or evaluation period is expired.

remarks.para: Each product or Maintenance package includes one year of free updates. This means that it is possible to use all licensed products released until plus one year. A product version build after the plus one year date can not be used with this license. In this case this property is set to true and the product is turned into an evaluation version.

strong.em: Of course, a correct combination of license and product can be used as long as you want. It's just not possible to update to a product version newer than plus one year.

remarks.para: If the evaluation period is expired this property is set to true.

member.value: True if either the service subscription or evaluation period expired; false otherwise

member.name: P:Technosoftware.UaServer.UaBaseServer.RestartRequired
member.summary: Indicates whether the server must be restarted. This is mainly the case if the server is used in evaluation mode and the 90 minutes evaluation time expired.
member.remarks: As long as the ServiceExpired flag is false a restart of the server is possible.
